meanings.definition: The technique of creating or enhancing the illusion of depth in an image by presenting two slightly different perspectives to each eye.
meanings.sent1: The stereoscopies in the movie made the scenes look like they were coming out of the screen.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed studying the stereoscopies in old photographs to understand how they were made.
meanings.sent3: The artist used stereoscopies to make the painting look like it had real depth, fooling everyone who saw it.
meanings.sent4: His use of stereoscopies in the design gave the room a sense of space that seemed almost magical.
meanings.sent5: The book explained the concept of stereoscopies with colorful illustrations that brought the idea to life.

meanings.definition: The study or practice of creating three-dimensional images or effects using stereoscopic techniques.
meanings.sent1: Learning about stereoscopies helped her understand how 3D movies are made.
meanings.sent2: The class focused on the history of stereoscopies and its impact on modern technology.
meanings.sent3: His passion for stereoscopies led him to create amazing 3D art that amazed everyone.
meanings.sent4: The exhibition showcased the artist's innovative use of stereoscopies to captivate the audience.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed a collection of stereoscopies that demonstrated the evolution of 3D imaging.
